Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the Azure Cache for Redis instance. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues.
Evaluate the current cache usage and scale the Azure Cache for Redis instance up or down based on application requirements.
Configure and perform regular backups of Redis data to ensure data resiliency and recovery in case of failures.
Review and update security policies, including firewall rules and access controls, to ensure the Redis instance is protected against unauthorized access.
Apply updates and patches to the Azure Cache for Redis instance to ensure it is running the latest version with all security fixes.
Conduct regular audits of the Redis configuration to ensure compliance with best practices and organizational policies.
Perform failover tests to ensure high availability and verify that the Redis instance can recover from failures without data loss.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize Redis configurations to improve response times and reduce latency.
Keep documentation for Azure Cache for Redis up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Run incident response drills to prepare the team for potential Redis outages or security incidents. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the performance of Azure Cache for Redis against the SLA metrics. Address any deviations or issues with Microsoft support.
Develop and execute plans for Redis capacity upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Redis features, best practices, and security measures.
Gather and analyze user feedback regarding Redis performance and reliability. Implement improvements based on this feedback.
